head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Accident Inquiry Begins

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Accident Inquiry Begins

body.head.byline: By MICHAEL WILSON; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: Occupational Safety and Health Administration investigates accident at Brooklyn Navy Yard that resulted in death of worker Christopher G Thomas when metal plate weighing thousands of pounds that was being used for repairs fell and crushed him; photo (S)

block.p: An investigation is under way into what caused a metal plate weighing thousands of pounds to fall and crush a worker to death on Saturday morning at the GMD Shipyard in the Brooklyn Navy Yard, a spokesman for the Occupational Safety and Health Administration said yesterday. ''We are conducting an investigation to determine whether any safety standards were violated,'' said Ted Fitzgerald, the spokesman. The worker, Christopher G. Thomas, above, was killed after being crushed by the plate, which was being used to repair a barge in dry dock. Mr. Thomas was working beneath the barge when the plate came loose and crashed to the ground. His sister-in-law, Kathy McLean, 45, said yesterday that family members planned to meet with officials from GMD today.
